intro: Euphrasia tatakensis, commonly known as the Tatakens Yellow-eyed Grass, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange, often with dark markings. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Euphrasia tatakensis is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
